trans-unit.source: Binds a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand"></xref> (or another <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ICommand"></xref> implementation).
A <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> associates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture> with an <xref:System.Windows.Input.ICommand> implementation.

<xref:System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand> is the primary implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ICommand> interface for the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] commanding system.

In general, when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture> is executed, the command is invoked, although the command behavior is further influenced by command-specific factors such as the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CanExecuteRoutedEventArgs.CanExecute%2A> value.
For more information on commanding, see the [Commanding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/commanding-overview.md).
When defining a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], there are two ways to specify the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture>.

The first way to establish a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] is to define the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding.Gesture%2A> attribute of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> element, which enables a syntax to specify mouse actions and modifiers as a single string; for example, "CTRL+LeftClick".
The second way is to define the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding.MouseAction%2A> attribute of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> element.
Both ways of setting the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture> are equivalent and modify the same underlying object, but there will be a conflict if both are used.
In the case when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding.MouseAction%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding.Gesture%2A> attributes are both set, the gesture is invalid.

In general, it is recommended that you use only the <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding.Gesture%2A> attribute from [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], even if you do not specify modifiers; this avoids ambiguity, provides the most streamlined syntax, and provides the most straightforward representation for serialization.

A <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> can be defined on a specific object or at the class level by registering a <xref:System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.RegisterClassInputBinding%2A> on the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CommandManager> class.

The most typical way to define a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> is within the control template, setting the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.InputBindings%2A> property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] by declaring one or more <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding> elements.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding"></xref> class, using the specified command and mouse gesture.
The command associated with the gesture.
The gesture associated with the command.
Copies the base (non-animated) values of the properties of the specified object.
The object to clone.
Copies the current values of the properties of the specified object.
The object to clone.
Creates an instance of an <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding"></xref>.
The new object.
Gets or sets the gesture associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture> is a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseAction> with or without a set of <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys>.
Unlike a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyGesture>, a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture> does not need to have a modifier key associated with it.
The gesture.
<xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding.Gesture"></xref> is set to `null`.
Creates the instance a frozen clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable"></xref> by using base (non-animated) property values.
The object to clone.
Creates the current instance a frozen clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable"></xref>.
If the object has animated dependency properties, their current animated values are copied.
The object to clone.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseAction"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding"></xref>.
Unlike a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyGesture>, a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture> does not need to be associated with a modifier key.
So a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseAction> by itself, such as <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseAction.MiddleClick>, can be a valid <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture>.
The mouse action.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseAction.None"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding.MouseAction"></xref> dependency property.
